intro: Syntherisma ciliaris, commonly known as the silverleaf spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features succulent, bluish-gray leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Syntherisma ciliaris is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and diverse ecological roles.
